result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Ann Remington

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:57 AM Defendant Melissa Ann Remington in Court.  Attorney Eric L Newmark in court for Melissa Ann Remington.  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Walker filed Information and has provided copy to Atty. Newmark.  Advises Court that Information mirrors Complaint with exception of date.  Further reading waived.  NG plea entered.  Court questions Defendant's address/phone.  She advises of change of phone, Court directs her to advise COC when picking up her NOH.

10:38 AM Defendant Melissa Ann Remington in Court.  Attorney Eric L Newmark in court for Melissa Ann Remington.  ADA Kaley Walker in Court for State of Wisconsin.  S/T Prescott Officer Luke McNamara.  Direct by ADA Walker.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Newmark.  ADA Walker states argument and requests Court find probable cause and bind Defendant over for trial.  Atty. Newmark states argument.  ADA Walker rebuts.  Atty. Newmark responds.  Court makes findings; based upon testimony of Officer Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 14, 2022 at 11:30 am.
filed by Atty Newmark

per Ct Comm Gavic - The request of the State that Officer McNamara be allowed to appear for the Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2002 at 2:30 p.m. is granted - E: DA & Atty. eif
Officer McNamara - Request to Appear Remotely for 8/16/22 PH filed by ADA Kaley Walker. To JRG for review. eif
NO CONTACT WITH M.J.L. WITH THE EXCEPTION OF PAYING RENT BY MAIL OR CONTACT INITIATED BY M.J.L.

3:04 PM Prosecuting Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Melissa Ann Remington in Court pro se.  Defendant advises she works nights and fell asleep.  Court quashes warrant.  Court confirms Defendant received a copy of the Complaint, advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Court advises Defendant of constitutional rights.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/no contact with M.J.L.  Defendant states that is her landlord.  Court questions if landlord resides there.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested w/exception of rent payments by mail or contact initiated by victim.  Defendant demands speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Advises she will be retaining counsel.  Court confirms she will have retained counsel by that time.  Adjourned at 3:13 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
10:02 AM Melissa Ann Remington in Court. ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Schieffer is requesting a Statewide warrant. Court will authorize warrant.
